respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)

history.provenance: From bindings of printed books and manuscripts unless otherwise noted.

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian library staff

msItem.title: Antiphons, harmonized.
msItem.note: The names of singers, who are nuns, are given.

layoutDesc.layout: On 8 staves of 4 lines

msItem.title: Frontispieces of books used in papal ceremonies, in the Sistine chapel with the arms of Urban VIII (1623-44) (defaced) and Alexander VII (1655-67) respectively.
msItem.note: In both cases the middle portion containing the text has been cut out. See B.Q.R.II (1917) 97, and for similar leaves T.J. Brown, Brit. Mus. Qu. 23 (1960) p.2.

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: temporale: portions of Thursday-Saturday in Easter week and 3rd and 4th Sundays after Easter

supportDesc.foliation: the first leaf with original foliation of LXXXVII

layoutDesc.layout: gothic notation on staves of 4 lines, 2 cols.

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: temporale: Holy Saturday, portions of the litany and blessing of the font

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 33 lines

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: temporale: reception of penitents on Maundy Thursday, gospel of the mandatum and beginning of Good Friday, baptismal service and mass of Holy Saturday, kyrie tropes without music (fol.14) and intonations of the Gloria

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of four red lines, 2 cols.

decoDesc.decoNote: Illuminated initials in blue, purple and gold

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: temporale: portion of Wednesday in Ember week of September

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 36 lines ruled in red

msItem.title: Antiphonal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: temporale: portion of matins and lauds for Corpus Christi

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 14 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: temporale, including portions of 13th and 14th Sundays after Trinity

supportDesc.extent: top and outer edges only of four leaves
supportDesc.foliation: original foliation of CLVII, CLVIII and CLXIIII, CLXV

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 32–3 lines

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum (choir breviary)
msItem.note: temporale: 1st Sunday in Advent; common of a confessor (fol.25) and several confessors (fol.26)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 42 lines or square notation on 14 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: (choir breviary, portions of the common of a confessor and of a virgin)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Gradual, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: (temporale: portions of Friday and Saturday in the first week of Lent)

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Antiphonal, Use of Sarum (?)
msItem.note: (temporale: matins, lauds and prime of Christmas)

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of 4 red lines, 2 cols.

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: (common of a martyr (matins))

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 7 staves of 5 red lines

history.provenance: Found in Oporto and given by Miss C.M. Cresswell , 1926

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: (temporale: blessing of holy water, portions of the third mass of Christmas and of Epiphany, end of the order of the mass, beginning of the Easter mass, and (fol.41) mass for Saturdays in September; sanctorale, vigil and feast of St. Andrew)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 36 lines; square notation on staves of 4 red lines

decoDesc.decoNote: Fine borders, historiated and other initials, fols. 36-40. (P&A iii. 717, pl. LXXII). Good border (mutilated), fol. 41. (P&A iii. 840)
Large illuminated initials and borders in blue, gold, rose, and carmine, with a miniature of the Resurrection (fol.39v)

msItem.note: see MS.Lat.liturg.b.7, fol.28

msItem.title: Breviary, Franciscan
msItem.note: sanctorale: portions of the Annunciation (25 March), Sts. Tiburtius, Valerianus and Maximus, and Anicetus (14, 17 April)

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of 4 red lines, 2 cols.

msItem.title: Missal, Dominican
msItem.note: portion of the order of the mass, including offertory prayers and prefaces of Christmas, Epiphany and Lent

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 23 lines, or 8 long staves of 3 red lines with square notation

msItem.title: Antiphonal, monastic (?)
msItem.note: combined temporale and sanctorale: 1st Sunday in Advent - Sunday after Christmas

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 6 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: (temporale: Palm Sunday)

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 12 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: temporale, masses for Wednesday and Thursday after Pentecost

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols.

history.provenance: Later used as a cover labelled ‘Thurnham from 1558 to 1602’, with ‘ Andrewe Johnson ’ written several times (16th cent.) and with a 19th cent. label ‘854’
Formerly MS. Lat. misc. a.3, fol.64

msItem.author: Johannes Beleth
msItem.title: Summa de ecclesiasticis officiis
msItem.note: cap.CI–CX.

supportDesc.extent: two fragments forming the greater part of a large bifolium

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 45 lines

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: with end of masses for the dead (cf. Sarum Missal, ed. Wickham Legg, pp.440–2) followed on verso by Trental of St. Gregory (cf. ibid. p.460) and beginning of Mass for the Name of Jesus, headed ‘Missa in honore et veneracione sancti nominis Ihesu contra infestaciones demonum.’

supportDesc.extent: larger part of one leaf(c.3 lines missing at top)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c.42 lines

decoDesc.decoNote: blue initials with red pen flourishing

history.provenance: Removed in 1975 from the binding of Auct. Y.4.6

bibl.title: Corpus of British Medieval Library Catalogues

category.catDesc: Auctoritates, Compilationes, Dicta, Excerta, Excerptiones, Flores, Notabilia, Notabilitates, Sententiae
Commentarii, Conclusiones, Expositiones, Glosae, Lecturae, Notulae, Proemia, Quaestiones, Scholia, Scripta

revisionDesc.change: James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
